While the South Newton plan ‚Äúrecommends‚Äù the use of facemasks, until further notice, we will require facemasks (for grades three and higher) until the Governor‚Äôs mandate is lifted.

Sincerely,
Mr. Hall

Want to know something SIMPLE that you can do at home to increase literacy and your child‚Äôs brain development?? TALK, TALK, TALK! Parent‚Äìchild conversations stimulate children‚Äôs growing language. The amount of language that young children hear is related to their vocabulary and language understanding.

The research is clear‚Äîengaging in two-way conversations is incredibly beneficial for children, regardless of age, gender, race, or socioeconomic status.

Dinner time is a great opportunity to gather and TALK. Sometimes conversations need a little kickstart. Use these table topics to get the conversation going at your next meal. Simply print (or write them on paper if you don‚Äôt have a printer) and place in a jar. Take turns choosing a topic to TALK about. Have fun!

I was so PARCHED that I drank all of my water and asked mom for more.

Dad looked WEARY when he got home from a long day at work.

She had a DISPUTE with her brother because they both wanted to play with the tablet.

3-5th

John SEVERED his thumb when he cut his apple into slices.

We had to COAX the dog to go outside during the storm.
